channel.title: Portforward
channel.description:
ok i just learned that utorrent fails lol , i need help portforwarding. i just got my default gateway to work so im ready to portforward. but i have no idea wat to do so can any one portforward?
msn: mccullom99@yahoo.com
please help i give u staff spot
i been trying to pf for ever and im sick of it can u do it?

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @Nameme123 Nameme123
item.description:
@Nameme123 wrote:

Here saves time:

http://portforward.com

Choose the type of router you have
by scrolling down on that page I just gave you.

Skip the advertisement.

Scroll down and find Runescape Private Server.

Follow the steps from then on.
Instead of where to goto on the
internet.
Except goto
Run>cmd>ipconfig
Find your Default Gateway and type
that into your web browser.

Then follow the steps

Hope this helps
-Nameme123

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote=“Duke Nukem, post:3, topic:352206”][quote]Visit your local ip : “192.168.1.1” And go next using this video http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EqzBaFz3OjU
[/quote]

I’m pretty sure that’s only if your using a Linksys router.

Here is a more specific way:
Go to your cmd and type: ipconfig
Now, whatever number comes up for your default gateway, put that in your browser.
Now you should be in your router screen (it may ask you for a user and pass to access, default for linksys is user:admin, pass:admin
Then you should go to the button that says: applications and gaming, or advanced (depends on what router you have)
When you get to the screen where you can put your ports in etc. and you there.[/quote]
All that is explained in that video though. Worked for me. But your way works to. Done that on my friends comp.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @Duke_Nukem Duke Nukem
item.description:
@Duke_Nukem wrote:

Visit your local ip : "192.168.1.1" And go next using this video [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EqzBaFz3OjU]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EqzBaFz3OjU[/url]

I’m pretty sure that’s only if your using a Linksys router.

Here is a more specific way:
Go to your cmd and type: ipconfig
Now, whatever number comes up for your default gateway, put that in your browser.
Now you should be in your router screen (it may ask you for a user and pass to access, default for linksys is user:admin, pass:admin
Then you should go to the button that says: applications and gaming, or advanced (depends on what router you have)
When you get to the screen where you can put your ports in etc. and you there.

Read full topic
